admission_text:
**Planting Fields Foundation is proud to share a brand new map of this beloved site!**

[Click here to download the map. ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/PF_Printed-Map_Tabloid_Master_Final-Artwork_MAP-ONLY-1.pdf)

**Gardens, greenhouses, woodland trails, artwork by Robert Winthrop Chanler and Everitt Shinn, a Gold Coast estate and more make Planting Fields a New York treasure.**

This 409-acre site features an incredible landscape designed by the same firm responsible for creating Central Park: the Olmsted Brothers. [Explore over 20 gardens](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Planting-Fields-Visitor-Map-2020.pdf), [stroll five miles of woodland trails](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Woodland-Trails-MAP.pdf), [delight in the warmth of the two greenhouses](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/landscape/), [tour a 65-room Tudor Revival mansion](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/happenings/category/estate-and-exhibition-tours/), and [enjoy our year-round programming! ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220095323/https://plantingfields.org/happenings/category/programs/)Start your next visit at the Visitor Center in the Main House. 

**PARK HOURS**  
The park is open **every day from 9am to 5pm** (closed December 25).

**PARKING*...
accessibility_text:
Planting Fields seeks to unite people with art, architecture and the outdoors by creating an inclusive community place and removing barriers to access. Our goal is to provide a welcoming and accessible space for all patrons, regardless of age, gender, race, or disability.

The grounds of Planting Fields are wheelchair accessible via paved roads and some gravel paths.

For visitors with mobility impairments, the following spaces and structures are also wheelchair accessible:

  * Visitor parking lots
  * The ground floor of the Main House
  * The Sensory Garden
  * The Camellia House
  * The Hay Barn
  * The Conference Center
  * Restrooms next to the Main Greenhouse

For access to Main House, please call 516.922.9226 or email [info@plantingfields.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101054227/mailto:info@plantingfields.org) to arrange for ramp access to the building during the following days and times:

For information on tours, [click here. ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101054227/https://plantingfields.org/hoursandadmission/)

Hearing Impaired Interpretation

For guests who are hearing impaired, interpreters are now available for tours and events upon request! Please email [info@plantingfields.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101054227/mailto:info@plantingfields.org) at least two weeks in advance of your preferred tour or event date to reserve an interpreter.

Translated Signage
